newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-MALCOM CHECKS AUSTRALIA WITH 3-14 BURST.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-MALCOM CHECKS AUSTRALIA WITH 3-14 BURST.

text.p: Devon Malcolm grabbed three wickets for 14 runs in 20 balls as England checked Australia's progress in the fifth Ashes test on Friday.
England captured five wickets for 103 on the second morning at Trent Bridge, but Australia were still in a strong position when they went to lunch at 405 for eight.

There was more bounce and swing on a humid day, with a number of deliveries lifting sharply, which enabled Andy Caddick and Dean Headley, then fellow paceman Malcolm, to peg back Australia after they resumed at 302 for three.
Mark Waugh was first to go, having added only eight to his overnight 60. He was trapped leg before by Caddick, ending a partnership of 86 with his twin brother Steve.
Three overs later Ricky Ponting played on to Headley for nine.
Malcolm came on as first change and further upset Australia's hopes of a huge total by dispatching Ian Healy, Shane Warne and Steve Waugh.
Healy, who had been struck painfully on the forearm by Headley, edged Malcolm to slip, having made 16, and Warne went in a similar way without scoring.

Steve Waugh proved harder to shift, driving and cutting beautifully, but on 75 his forward defensive stroke was beaten by a superb delivery from Malcolm which left the batsman just enough to uproot the off stump.
Paul Reiffel (19 not out) and Jason Gillespie (9 not out) were together at lunch.
Australia lead 2-1 in the six-test series and need only draw here to retain the Ashes, of which they are holders.
